snippet: Blackstone and Wells Fargo are poised to buy most of the portfolio, which includes office and apartment buildings, people with knowledge of the matter said.
abstract: General Electric, in move to cut its exposure to financial services, is ready to sell its huge real estate portfolio for about $30 billion; Blackstone and Wells Fargo will buy most of portfolio.

byline.contributor: Michael Corkery and Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Blackstone and Wells Fargo are poised to buy most of the portfolio, which includes office and apartment buildings, people with knowledge of the matter said.

headline.main: G.E. Seen Close to Selling Its Real Estate Portfolio
headline.print_headline: In Bid to Refocus, G.E. Is Said to Be Close to Selling Real Estate Portfolio
